body.head.byline: By THOMAS J. LUECK; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Khalid Latif, imam who has served as chaplain and adviser at Princeton University and New York University, is appointed chaplain for Muslim members of New York City Police Dept (S)

block.p: Khalid Latif, 24, an imam who has served as a chaplain and adviser at Princeton University and New York University, was appointed yesterday as chaplain for Muslim members of the Police Department. Mr. Latif, who holds a master's degree from Hartford Seminary, is the second Muslim to join the Christian and Jewish clergy members in the department's chaplains' unit. He succeeds Izak-El M. Pasha, a spiritual leader to thousands of black Muslims, who retired a year ago. Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly said yesterday that the number of Muslims in the department was ''in the thousands.''
